U: S. Rep. Patrick Murphy frequently attacked Marco Rubio's absence from votes during his presidential campaign.
Murphy: s ad questioned how Rubio could protect the public if he failed to show up for work.
The ad claimed that Rubio didn: t show up for a vote on his own bill on sanctions against Hezbollah.
The Rubio camp argued that there wasn: t a formal vote on the Hezbollah sanctions bill, but rather it passed by unanimous consent.
